column1: #Summary1=(human1) In this poem, the narrator tells of hiding inside their flower, which the poem's addressee, unsuspecting, wears, while feeling almost a loneliness for the narrator.

#Summary2=(claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022; postedited) A poem expresses the narrator's desire to secretly be close to their beloved by becoming a corsage worn on their breast and later elicits loneliness when they fades from their vase, with only angels knowing the full truth of these hidden feelings.

#Summary3=(gpt4o) The narrator conceals themselves in a flower worn on another's breast, symbolizing an intimate, unperceived connection that's acknowledged by angels, and evokes a sense of loneliness when the flower fades from a vase, leaving the wearer unknowingly longing for the hidden presence.
#Summary4=(Meta-Llama-3-8B-Instruct) The poem describes a secret sorrow or loss hidden within a person's innocence, worn on their person without realization, and known to angels.
#Summary5=(Qwen2.5-3B-Instruct; postedited) The poem describes hiding within a flower and being worn by an unsuspecting loved one, who has a feeling of loneness.
#Text=I HIDE myself within my flower , That wearing on your breast , You , unsuspecting , wear me too —
#Text=I hide myself within my flower , That , fading from your vase , You , unsuspecting , feel for me Almost a loneliness .
